postcards.caption: The Insanely Beautiful Sunsets Of Boracay.
postcards.trivia: Boracay has been highly celebrated in the international media as one of the best islands and having one of the best beaches in the world, including by Travel + Leisure Magazine, CNN, the New York Times Travel, and many others.
postcards.weather: With an average year-round temperature of 30°C, and an average humidity of 75%

postcards.caption: A Slice Of Paradise!
postcards.trivia: Santorini is one of the Cyclades islands in the Aegean Sea. It was devastated by a volcanic eruption in the 16th century BC, forever shaping its rugged landscape.
postcards.weather: An average high-temperature of 28°C (82.4°F) and an average low-temperature of 22°C (71.6°F).

postcards.caption: Most iconic landmark, St. Basil Cathedral And Its Fairytale-Castle Spires.
postcards.trivia: Moscow claims the largest number of billionaires in the world. Per Forbes, there are 84 billionaires in the city.
postcards.weather: With an average high-temperature of 24.3°C (75.7°F) and an average low-temperature of 14.4°C (57.9°F)

postcards.caption: Christ the Redemeer statue stands 98 ft tall, overlooking the city of Rio De Janeiro.
postcards.trivia: Rich cultural history includes the creation and popularization of Bossa Nova. Translated, Bossa Nova means “new trend.” It is a lively mix of jazz and samba that came to life in the 1950s and 1960s.
postcards.weather: In Rio de Janeiro, the summers are short, hot, oppressive, wet, and mostly cloudy and the winters are long, comfortable, humid, and mostly clear.

postcards.caption: Stay Golden, San Francisco.
postcards.trivia: The color of the Golden Gate Bridge is called International Orange. It wasn't a color from the original list of options. It was the primer used to protect the steel for the bridge during transit and the architect loved it more than the other options, so he selected it as the official color.

postcards.caption: Be Captivated By The Sonnen Berg Sea Of Clouds.
postcards.trivia: Sonnen Berg translates to sun mountain. The main view deck sits at 2,670 feet above the river valley and offers an epic mountain view.

postcards.caption: Rome Was Not Built In A Day!
postcards.trivia: Italy's capital city, Rome is also known for a history that dates back to the eras of Octavian, Julius Caesar and Hadrian, among others. Left behind are structures like the Pantheon, the Roman Forum and dozens of churches, among other historic gems.
postcards.weather: Rome has a Mediterranean climate with cool winters and warm and hot summers. The temperatures can vary with lows of 2°C in January to the highs of 30°C.

postcards.caption: The Chocolate Hills- Mounds Of A Generally Conical And Almost Symmetrical Shape.
postcards.trivia: It is known that at the bare minimum there are 1268 unusually shaped hills located in the middle of the island of Bohol, but some estimates put this number as high as 1776.
postcards.weather: The coastal area of the province is warm in contrast with its interior which is colder especially during the night. Mean annual temperature is recorded at 27o C.

postcards.caption: Finest White Sand Island Hopping In The Beautiful Islands Of Cebu.
postcards.trivia: Cebu City was the first Spanish settlement in the Philippines.  In 1521, Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan arrived in Cebu to claim the archipelago for Spain.
postcards.weather: The climate in Cebu City is hot, oppressive, windy, and overcast. Over the course of the year, the temperature typically varies from 75°F to 90°F

postcards.caption: Paris, You Had Me At Bonjour.
postcards.trivia: This interesting fact about Paris is known to many, but only a few people know why Paris gained the name of the City of Light. The name comes from the 17th century and the Age of Enlightenment.
postcards.weather: Paris experiences mostly mild weather across four distinct seasons. Average daily highs range from 46°F (8°C) in the winter to 77°F (25°C) at the height of summer.

postcards.caption: Beautiful Taal Volcano Lake View!
postcards.trivia: Another must-see in Tagaytay is the Puzzle Mansion, which houses the largest collection of jigsaw puzzles, and has been featured in the Guinness Book of World Records.
postcards.weather: Tagaytay has warm temperatures year round ranging between 29°C (85°F) and 33°C (92°F)

postcards.caption: A Bustling Beauty Of History, Culture And Entertertainment.
postcards.trivia: If you ever dreamt of living on a houseboat, Amsterdam is the city for you! With over 165 canals, it is possible to travel 100 kilometers (60 miles) on the water in the city limits.
postcards.weather: The weather in Amsterdam is fairly mild during wintertime. However temperatures can drop below freezing.

postcards.caption: 2022 Best Place To Visit
postcards.trivia: Palawan is a long island located just off the western flank of the Philippines and a paradise from end to end. Best known for its bright blue waters that contrast against the karst stone cliffs of the island, this is one of the most popular resort destinations in the Philippines.
postcards.weather: The temperature in Palawan averages between 75°F and 84°F (24°C-29°C) in both dry and wet season.

postcards.caption: Riu Palace Cabo San Lucas Overlooks A stunning White Sand Beach Ensuring Your Vacation Will Be An Unforgettable One.
postcards.trivia: Starting in early December and continuing through mid-March, hundreds of whales migrate 6,000 miles from the frigid waters of the Arctic Ocean to the warm, calm waters surrounding the Baja Peninsula. Balmy weather, ideal salinity and abundant marine life make the bays and lagoons around Los Cabos the perfect place for whales to birth and rear their young.
postcards.weather: In Cabo San Lucas, the summers are long, hot, oppressive, and mostly cloudy and the winters are comfortable, dry, and partly cloudy.

postcards.caption: Dubai, With All Of The Glitz And Glamour Rose In The Heart Of The Desert.
postcards.trivia: The Dubai Police has way more pizzazz than any police force in the world. They have a range of supercars such as the exotic Bugatti, Ferrari, Bentley, Lamborghini, Camaro, Mercedes and many more at their disposal.
postcards.weather: In Dubai, the summers are long, sweltering, oppressive, arid, and partly cloudy and the winters are comfortable, dry, and mostly clear.

postcards.caption: Famous Electric Red Tourist Panoramic Train In Swiss Village Lungern.
postcards.trivia: Located 750 meters above sea level on the eastern side of the Lake of Lungern, at the foot of the Brunig Pass, the village of Lungern lies in the highest part of the canton of Obwalden. It is the highest known village of the Sarneraa valley.
postcards.weather: From July to August the daytime temperature range is 18 to 28 °C (65° - 82° F) and from January to February the range is -2 to 7 °C (28° - 45° F). In spring and autumn, the daytime temperature range is 8 to 15 °C (46° - 59° F).

postcards.caption: Skiing Is The Next Best Thing To Having Wings - Oprah Winfrey
postcards.trivia: Singer John Denver made Aspen his home and was inspired by the town's beauty when he wrote his 1972 world-recognized hit, Rocky Mountain High.
postcards.weather: The climate in Aspen is cold and temperate. The rainfall in Aspen is significant, with precipitation even during the driest month.

postcards.caption: Happiness Is The Sun Setting Over A Beach In Hawaii.
postcards.trivia: Maui is home to just two volcanoes, both of which are dormant. These volcanoes are Haleakala, one of the worlds biggest dormant volcanoes, and Mauna Kahalawai.

postcards.caption: Picture Perfect Island Paradise
postcards.trivia: The famous Island that used to be featured in James Bond sequel “The Man With The Golden Gun”. Situated in Phang Nga Bay, James Bond Island is not located in Phuket province but Phang Nga province. Also known by the name of Koh Tapu (nail island) due to its shape, the island is a major tourists attraction that tour operators do not miss to include in their itineraries.

postcards.caption: Picture Perfect Island Paradise
postcards.trivia: The famous Island that used to be featured in James Bond sequel “The Man With The Golden Gun”. Situated in Phang Nga Bay, James Bond Island is not located in Phuket province but Phang Nga province. Also known by the name of Koh Tapu (nail island) due to its shape, the island is a major tourists attraction that tour operators do not miss to include in their itineraries.
